org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Class ReplaceDictMasker<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
      • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.ReplaceDictMasker<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data to be masked.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDictionaryMasker<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceDateDictMasker, ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceDecimalDictMasker, ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceStringDictMasker

    public class ReplaceDictMasker<T>
extends AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
    Replaces the list of input data with the provided replacement list.

    • Method Detail

      • maskList

        public void maskList(java.util.List<T> data)
        Replaces the input list with this object's replacement list.

        The input list must be of equal size or smaller than the replacement list, as the input could otherwise not be masked entirely. If the input is smaller, not all of the replacement values will be used.

        Parameters:
        data - The list of data on which the masking is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the replacement list is smaller than the input list.

      • getReplacementList

        public java.util.List<T> getReplacementList()
